articles.title: 'It's all going right for Arsenal' - can they make it count this time?
articles.summary: Arsenal end 2025 with a statement win and clear at the top of the Premier League - can they make it count this time?

articles.summary: Who will win the Premier League, Champions League and Ballon d'Or in 2026? It's time to make your predictions.

articles.title: Gabriel & Saliba dominate as Arsenal make 'big statement'
articles.summary: Match of the Day pundit Danny Murphy analyses how Gabriel Magalhaes and William Saliba dominated in defence for Arsenal in their 4-1 victory over Aston Villa.

articles.title: Set-pieces 'becoming a problem' for Chelsea
articles.summary: Match of the Day pundits Danny Murphy and Rob Green discuss where Chelsea fell short in defending set pieces in their 2-2 draw with Bournemouth.

articles.title: Arsenal score four second-half goals to thrash Villa
articles.summary: Arsenal score four second-half goals to beat Aston Villa 4-1 and end the year five points clear at the top of the Premier League table.

articles.title: Bournemouth draw with Chelsea after chaotic first half
articles.summary: Bournemouth are winless against Chelsea in their last nine Premier League matches after drawing 2-2 at Stamford Bridge.

articles.title: Brighton come from behind twice to draw with West Ham
articles.summary: Brighton & Hove Albion come back from behind twice to draw 2-2 with West Ham United in a match that saw three penalties awarded in the first half.

articles.title: Match of the Day
articles.summary: Highlights of six Premier League games, including Arsenal v Aston Villa.

articles.title: 'Definitely not' Semenyo's last game for Bournemouth - Iraola
articles.summary: Bournemouth manager Andoni Iraola reflects on his team's 2-2 draw against Chelsea and discusses speculation that forward Antoine Semenyo is set to leave the club in January.

articles.title: Football Daily
articles.summary: Arsenal increase their lead at the top of the Premier League table.

articles.title: Hamilton players threaten no-show after pay delay
articles.summary: Hamilton Academical players are considering refusing to play Saturday's Scottish League 1 match against East Fife if they are not paid on time.

articles.title: Matlock rehire boss Clayton 48 hours after he left
articles.summary: Adam Clayton becomes his own managerial replacement after being appointed Matlock Town boss two days after he was released by mutual consent.

articles.title: Wiegman gets honorary damehood in New Year Honours
articles.summary: Ice skaters Jayne Torvill and Christopher Dean become a dame and knight in the New Year Honours list, while England women's manager Sarina Wiegman is made an honorary dame.

articles.title: 'Let's make history' - Miura, 58, joins new club
articles.summary: Kazuyoshi Miura, who turns 59 in February and is the world's oldest professional footballer, has signed a loan deal until June with Fukushima United.

articles.title: 'It's a mystery' - why Premier League teams haven't played every club yet
articles.summary: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains why Premier League teams have not played every opponent yet despite being at the midway point in the season.

articles.title: 'Absolutely pivotal' - Championship transfer window preview
articles.summary: With the winter window opening on 1 January, BBC Sport correspondents assess the transfer needs of the 24 Championship clubs.

articles.title: Humphries books Van Veen showdown as Anderson dumps out MvG
articles.summary: Luke Humphries set up a quarter-final showdown with Gian van Veen at the World Darts Championship after beating Kevin Doets, as Gary Anderson thrashed Michael van Gerwen at the Alexandra Palace.

articles.summary: Luke Humphries beat Kevin Doets 4-1 to progress through to the quarter finals of the World Darts Championship.
